# SOURCE: DOE Desalination Databases: # DESCRIPTION: Water treatment energy consumption curves for brackish water reverse osmosis (BWRO) systems at three salinity levels typical of the Sinai Red Sea region. Values represent energy requirements
Toray): and brine production for desalination operations.
energy_kwh_per_m3_* (kWh per cubic meter of product water)
Academic Literature on BWRO Systems: recovery_rate_pct (percent of feedwater recovered as product)
column5: brine_disposal_m3_per_m3_product (cubic meters brine per cubic meter product water)

# SOURCE: DOE Desalination Databases: # LOGIC: Energy consumption increases with feedwater salinity due to higher osmotic pressure requiring greater pumping energy. Recovery rates decrease with salinity to prevent membrane scaling and maintain permeate quality. Brine volume = (1/recovery_rate) - 1. Typical values based on modern BWRO systems with energy recovery devices.
# ASSUMPTIONS: Single-pass BWRO with energy recovery devices (ERDs)
Toray): operating temperature 25-30C typical of Sinai region
Academic Literature on BWRO Systems: membrane age 0-3 years (performance within manufacturer specs)
